title: 108_s1626
content: The Act titled "Emergency Agricultural Disaster Assistance Act of 2003" provides crop disaster assistance. The Emergency Agricultural Disaster Assistance Act of 2003 authorizes the Secretary of Agriculture to provide emergency financial assistance to producers who have suffered qualifying crop losses due to damaging weather for the 2001, 2002, or 2003 crops. The assistance is administered in a similar manner as provided under a previous Act. The Emergency Agricultural Disaster Assistance Act of 2003 allows the Secretary of Agriculture to provide financial aid to producers who have experienced crop losses due to severe weather for the 2001, 2002, or 2003 crops. The assistance is given based on specific loss thresholds and payment rates, without discriminating against producers who have purchased crop insurance. Under the Federal Crop Insurance Act, assistance for crop losses is reduced by the amount received under any other Federal law. SEC. 3. Livestock Assistance Program. The Secretary will use funds from the Commodity Credit Corporation to provide payments for livestock losses to producers in designated counties for 2001, 2002, or 2003. Assistance will be administered similarly to the American Indian livestock program under the Agriculture Appropriations Act of 2001. The Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2001 reduces assistance for livestock losses under this section by the amount provided under any other Federal law. SEC. 4. FUNDING. The Secretary will use funds from the Commodity Credit Corporation as needed to implement this Act. SEC. 5. REGULATIONS. The Secretary may issue necessary regulations for implementing the Act without following certain procedural requirements. Congressional review of agency rulemaking will be conducted under specified authority. The Act also includes provisions for emergency designation. SEC. 6. EMERGENCY DESIGNATION. The President must submit an official budget request designating the entire amount as an emergency requirement. Congress designates the amount as an emergency requirement under specific sections of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985. SEC. 7. BUDGETARY TREATMENT. SEC. 7. BUDGETARY TREATMENT. The provisions of this Act that would impact direct spending or receipts under the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 will be treated as such.
